Posts.Content: Hi SheppyÂ  I was diagnosed on 18th April following a mammogram- I had no symptoms and to be honest I’m still in shock. Like you I’m keeping a brave face on the surface - I have my first consultant appointment on Monday and then hopefully my operation date after that. Only after the op will I know what I’m dealing with. I too feel quite alone and absolutely terrified. I can’t face anyone either. The waiting and not knowing is awful. My cat who is usually quite aloof now follows me around the house and sleeps on the bed next to me! He never does that!! As I’m new here I can’t offer you advice at the moment - just know you aren’t alone x everyone here is very supportive. Keep your chin up xx

Posts.Content: You are very welcome Sheppy and to be honest coming on here gives me comfort too - it’s early days for us both - I don’t know about you but my mind is all over the place! I’ve downloaded a Meditation app called Calm. Going to give that a go to see if I can try and relax!!
